intro: Sida divergens, commonly known as the blueweed or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, often with a rough texture, and it produces small, round, greenish-brown seeds. Sida divergens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
